definitions.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the repository, e.g. a UUID.  This 'id' is unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system.
definitions.name: id

definitions.description: A 'business' identifier  or accession number for the entity, typically as provided by an external system or authority, that persists across implementing systems  (i.e. a  'logical' identifier).

fields.description: The system or namespace that defines the identifier.
fields.name: system

fields.description: The value of the identifier, as defined by the system.
fields.name: value

definitions.name: identifier

definitions.description: Short name or abbreviation for dataset. Maps to rdfs:label.
definitions.name: label

definitions.description: Broad categorization of the contents of the data file.
definitions.name: data_category

definitions.description: Specific content type of the data file.
definitions.name: data_type

definitions.description: A reference to the Project(s) of which this ResearchSubject is a member. The associated_project may be embedded using the $ref definition or may be a reference to the id for the Project - or a URI expressed as a string to an existing entity.
definitions.name: associated_project

definitions.description: A string of characters used to identify a resource on the Data Repo Service(DRS).
definitions.name: drs_uri

definitions.description: Size of the file in bytes. Maps to dcat:byteSize.
definitions.name: byte_size

definitions.description: A digit representing the sum of the correct digits in a piece of stored or transmitted digital data, against which later comparisons can be made to detect errors in the data.
definitions.name: checksum

definitions.description: Data modality describes the biological nature of the information gathered as the result of an Activity, independent of the technology or methods used to produce the information.
definitions.name: data_modality

definitions.description: An imaging modality describes the imaging equipment and/or method used to acquire certain structural or functional information about the body. These include but are not limited to computed tomography (CT) and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI). Taken from the DICOM standard.
definitions.name: imaging_modality

definitions.description: The dbgap accession number for the project.
definitions.name: dbgap_accession_number

definitions.description: The 'logical' identifier of the series or grouping of imaging files in the system of record which the file is a part of.
definitions.name: imaging_series

definitions.description: List of ids of Subject entities associated with the File
definitions.name: Subjects

definitions.description: List of ids of ResearchSubject entities associated with the File
definitions.name: ResearchSubjects

definitions.description: List of ids of Specimen entities associated with the File
definitions.name: Specimens
